body:
As a general rule. The sky is blue. (Except at night. Or in the early morning. Or when it's overcast.)
Water is wet. (Except when it's steam. Or ice.)
Politicians lie. (Except.... Uhhh..... Sorry. i got nothing.)

body:
The sky is never black. It’s blue night and day. Just different shades. But, yeah, it’s other colors sometimes.

Also, water is always wet. Steam is wet. Ice is wet.
body_html:
The sky is never black. It’s blue night and day. Just different shades. But, yeah, it’s other colors sometimes.

Also, water is always wet. Steam is wet. Ice is wet.

author.bio: Conservative and no, I won't sit down and shut up.
author.bio_html: Conservative and no, I won't sit down and shut up.

body:
Steam is a gas. The "steam" you can see is condensed water vapor. 

Ice is the solid phase of water. It is hydrogen-bonded to itself, and cannot absorb or adsorb to another surface or substance. It may be coated in a fine layer of liquid or semi-liquid water (the exact physics is pretty complicated,) but ice is by no means wet.
body_html:
Steam is a gas. The "steam" you can see is condensed water vapor.

Ice is the solid phase of water. It is hydrogen-bonded to itself, and cannot absorb or adsorb to another surface or substance. It may be coated in a fine layer of liquid or semi-liquid water (the exact physics is pretty complicated,) but ice is by no means wet.
